title: Go on, Scream
body:
Featuring OC / Seamus Finnegan. He’s always feared banshees. Her grandmother is one. Why is it, then, that she seems more afraid of herself than he is?

Please Be Serious

Seamus and Audriell exchanged long, wary glances from across their library table. Seamus pushed away his schoolwork and shut his books, forfeiting any illusion of studying. This seemed to snap…

summary: God SAME about the Harry Styles thing. I mean I have absolutely heard his music before. And then last week I HEARD it and it...
question: God SAME about the Harry Styles thing. I mean I have absolutely heard his music before. And then last week I HEARD it and it just kinda went whoa. I think I avoided it for a long time because of the one direction thing, like I was an edgy middle schooler. In England. When they were at their peak. So like obviously I ‘hated’ them, but like now it’s like just.. whoa.... this song is so good..
answer: right???? like 1D was everywhere and liking it was forced down our throats so i shut it down. and i heard some of the songs the others made and theyre good but theyre not.. Good, yknow? so kudos to harry for having a song that caught me by my heart

blog.name: thetrainwreckjournals
blog.title: The Trainwreck Journals
blog.description: This is literally the journal of a self proclaimed trainwreck.

body:
Who’s ready for Werewolf Harry???

Beauty and the Beast Summary

Ivy Marie Parker was a smart girl, Ivy was logical (although very dramatic) and somewhat social and definitely not a believer. Ivy didn’t do supernatural unless in the form of novels or tv shows or movies. Ivy also knew to keep away from Eden Manor, the huge castle with the rich folk and a slightly dodgy reputation. Then Ivy got drunk and woke up in a makeshift hospital and met a grumpy Adonis look alike who made her question every belief she ever had. She also found herself wanting to be around the Adonis look alike who may have been a serial killer for all she knew. Logic be damned.

Harry Edward Styles was a bit of a grouch, at least around new people. Happy still, but quite grumpy. Harry was what you could describe as slightly cynical and a little bit protective (very protective) and someone who didn’t think that he’d ever meet someone who’d ever put up with him. Werewolfing is a time-consuming task. Then he met the small girl who knocked herself unconscious in the woods who eventually turned his life upside down and caused him all sorts of grief and the appearance of stress related frown lines.

 Long story short; somewhat of a disaster story


Story to be posted on @cheekyrascalsss

title: Cold Feet
body:
Summary: Y/N can’t sleep 

Warnings: fluff:)

Word Count: 637 words

Based on: “Quit touching me, your feet are cold!”

“Harry! Quit touching me,” Y/N whisper-shouts in the darkness. The light-wash curtains allowed creases of moonlight to slither through the peaks, illuminating just enough for Y/N to see Harry’s mop of head cradled by the pillow.

He remained unbothered, only breathing a tad deeper despite Y/N hitting his shin with the soles of her feet as gently as she could because she knows that Harry had been experiencing pain in that area from his workouts. Silent snores released from his nostrils and his chapped lips parted in a damp separation that made an audible sound in the darkness of the room.

Y/N huffs while she jerks her head back on her cotton pillow. The softness of the object absorbing much of the frustrated force she had put into the action. She feels herself drift off into sleep again after a few minutes and she could literally taste the heavenly bliss of sleeping when a cold touch sends her reeling upright against the mattress.

“H, can you wake up please,” She states quietly, not wanting to alarm him but still wanting him to be aware of her current dilemma.

Y/N’s hand blindly reaches for his broad shoulder tilted towards her since his back was facing her front. She shakes him from his slumber and it has him rolling over in her direction almost to the point where he completely crushes her with his body.

“What’s up, Y/N?” Harry’s voice was gruff and heavy, sleep snaking through his tongue and making the sound an octave lower than usual. The tiredness in his body affected his voice as his tone barely changed at the end of the sentence.

“Quit touching me with your feet!’

He lifts his cheek from its position snuggled deeply into his own pillow.

“S’wrong with my feet?”

“Your feet are cold,” Y/N pouts when Harry chuckles lazily at her complaint. Lids closing sluggishly at her and she knew that if he could, Harry would be rolling his eyes at her right now.

“‘M sorry, lovie” He mumbles against the pillow. His energy had dwindled and he let his head mope its way back down against the object, making his apology barely audible to Y/N’s ears.

Y/N shuffles back down so that her body is aligned for sleeping. She sighs restfully, finally being able to get some shut-eye without Harry’s cold feet turning her own legs into icicles.

She could hear him snicker to himself. Before she could ask why, she felt his frosty flesh make contact with her warm ones and she squeaks in surprise, body whipping fast in his direction to scold him for doing that when she had profusely asked him not to.

“Ugh, why are you like this?”

“Like wha’?” His humor was funny to him since he was still letting out chuckles here and there.

“You’re impossible,” Y/N strays from the warmth she’d been collecting and grabs a pillow before letting her feet meet her slippers. She scoots her bum to the side of the bed, twisting her body to smack Harry was the pillow in her hand.

“Ow” 

It was muffled, but she could hear it and she giggles prior to making her way to the guest bedroom.

“Hey, hey what are you– where are you going?” His eyes snap open when he heard the shuffling of Y/N’s heavy feet on the hardwood.

“‘M sleeping at the guest bed tonight,” Her hands extend in front of her, hoping that she doesn’t accidentally stub her toe onto something.

“Wait, ‘m sorry Y/N,” He says, hand balling up into a fist and knuckling against his lids in a cute manner. “‘M serious this time,”

“Reeally?”

“Yeah, ‘m gonna keep my cold feet to myself,”

—-

omg it’s short but it so cute i cannot even 

permanent taglist;  @ynm1505 @kissme-hs @agoddamnmango @kettxo @send-me-styles @ofpeppermintbay @harrys-kingdom  @calums-sugarbaby @ashkuuuu

summary: what about y/n having commitment issues or the fear of marriage? She knows Harry loves her and wants her to be his future wife...
question: what about y/n having commitment issues or the fear of marriage? She knows Harry loves her and wants her to be his future wife and she loves him endlessly too but whenever marriage is brought up by him and his/her family, she gets all quiet and sort of defensive. Harry would just hug her when she admits her fears (inspired by Mine- the 1975 lmao) 🥰
answer:
- @averycummmingsss: hi!!! I love your writing and I was wondering if you could write something where Y/N and Harry get in a big fight at Anne or Gemma’s? And how his family member reacts or something like that? I really enjoyed your Miscarriage piece btw!!!!

-katie im hungry feed me more angst please thank you

-angst angst angst angst angst angst (i love you)

This is a combo of all of the above requests, the last two of which I’m pretty sure are from @talesofstyles but I could be wrong… anyway, this is my last request of the weekend (yeet?) so later I’m going to write the next thing for A Series of Parental Events 😁 thoughts please! Kate xxx

A weekend away to Anne’s had seemed like the perfect idea when Harry had first suggested it. You both needed some time away, to relax and recover because you were both feeling a little overworked.

It’s been a hectic few months to say the least, with your own family seemingly trying to reek havoc in your life at every opportunity, you tend to lean into Harry’s family more because they’re more understanding. Your family don’t dislike Harry, no that’s not it. It’s more that they seem to think he’s a sort of toy, a shiny object to be shown off in front of other people. It’s more like a ‘look who our daughter managed to bag as her boyfriend’.

And you’d rather keep Harry away from that, because it’s the last thing he needs from anyone. He always says he doesn’t mind, but you mind. You love him, probably a bit too much, besotted being a more appropriate term. You love him with everything you have. Honestly, you’re surprised he’s not ran a hundred miles in the opposite direction. But he hadn’t.

“Oh I can’t wait to see you two get married one day.” Anne sighs contentedly after dinner, gazing across the table at you with a warmth you don’t think you’ve seen even from your own mother.

You evidently stiffen in your seat, Harry’s hand immediately clapping to your thigh as reassurance. You hate that you have to react this way, because as you’ve already mentioned you love the man with your whole ass fucking heart. But Anne doesn’t know if your insecurities to really commit. She doesn’t know that Harry’s already proposed once, with a ring and everything, and you said ‘no’. You said no because you’re terrified of failure. It’s not the marriage side of it, it’s the fact that in the future everything might not be so perfect, and you and Harry might just fall out of love with you and… divorce you. He maintains that he won’t regularly, but he can’t see into the future so how would he know?

Your entire life you’ve been surrounded by divorce, most people you know - their parents have divorced. You have friends who’ve already married and divorced, why would you be any different?

Harry tries to brush off the subject with an awkward laugh and a gentle squeeze to your thigh. “Steady on, Mum.”

“Well you’ve been together nearly four years!” Anne chuckles. “Poor girl probably thinks you don’t want to marry her!”

“He already asked.” You blurt, unable to look either of them in the eye all of a sudden. You’re hot with anxiety, you can already feel the panic starting to settle into the back of your neck. “He already asked and I said ‘no’.”

Anne confusedly blinks between the two of you, her brows slowly knitting together until they’re one. “You proposed, Harry?” She sounds hurt now, and that upsets you even more.

Harry swallows the lump in his throat. “I did, yeah. Few months back.” His voice is tight, ill with worry.

“Why didn’t you say anything?” Anne’s voice is soft, but still laced with a hurt that even you can’t ignore.

“Wanted it to be a surprise.” He shrugs, his tone verging on the point of sullen.

“It’s my fault, I’m the one that said ‘no’.” You stammer, wriggling in your seat as you continue to stare at the bend of the table.

“She’s not ready yet.” Harry surmises, slipping his hand from your thigh to lock his fingers with yours, like a show of solidarity that’s not really necessary. “And I’m okay with that.”

As much as you appreciate Harry’s understanding, the insinuation that you might be ready to marry in the future has your head spinning. Because what if you don’t ever find yourself ready? What if you never overcome that fear of failure? What if you really do end up losing him? Maybe it’d be safer to just end it..?

You quickly excuse yourself from the table before you break down in front of Harry and his mum, and flee to Harry’s bedroom to hide your looming panic attack in there. The comfort of Harry’s bedroom is simultaneously better and worse. Better because everything about him calms you, and the room is full of just him, even after years away from home his smell lingers on everything and it’s so completely intoxicating. But it’s worse because in your current frame of mind some of this may never be yours again, and that thought really has you sobbing.

“Hey,” Harry isn’t too far behind you, closing the door with a click and falling to his knees where you’re sat panting on the edge of the bed, “hey, I’m sorry. Maybe I should’ve told her, I didn’t know she’d react like that.”

You shake your head as you attempt to fight the tears that now threaten behind your eyes. “I don’t know if I can do this, Harry.”

Harry’s expression begins to mirror Anne’s from moments earlier, confusion washing over him. “What do you mean, love?”

“I mean I can’t give you what you want and it’s not fair.” You’re stressing over your words, your throat tight with every syllable you spit out.

“Angel, don’t do that.” Harry begs, taking both hands in his. “You don’t mean that.”

“Harry, your entire family are sitting on the edge of their seats waiting for me to say ‘yes’ so they can yomp me down the aisle! And I don’t know if I’ll ever be ready for that!” Your voice has raised in volume, like you’ve internally snapped and you’ve had enough.

“It doesn’t matter!”

“It does matter, Harry! It matters because regardless of the fact that we barely spoke about marriage before you proposed, it’s the only thing I’ve heard about since! And we’ve been together long enough that people are going to find it weird!”

Harry shakes his head, looking to the floor as he speaks. “Do you really think I care what other people want? I was done doing that a long time ago, I don’t intend to go back to it.”

“But you do want a wife and a family, and I don’t know if I’m the right person to give you that!”

Harry’s head snaps up, eyes brimming with wet tears. “Don’t do this, love. Please. If you’re worried about your family, you know I don’t mind them. If you never decide to marry me, I don’t care. I’d fucking love to have you as my wife, but I’d also happily have just you without the title. I just need you.”

“The thing is, Harry, I don’t know if just me is enough. You deserve more.”

“Stop it!” He scolds with a near scowl, standing quickly with your hands still in his. “You don’t get to just make this decision on your own! There’s two of us in this relationship, you can’t just throw away four years because you’re scared!”

“And you can’t force me to stay in it either!” You stand too, tearing your hands from his hold. “I don’t want to be the one your family hates because I won’t give you what you want!”

“Love, for the last time, I only want you!”

The last brick in your defensive wall is cracking, until it finally breaks and those tears you’ve been fighting win their way through. You feel defeated, deflated and a little defenceless. You’ve ran out of excuses to fight him with. You don’t want to leave him, not at all. You realise that throwing away your relationship with Harry would be throwing away the best thing you’ll ever have. And even if you do lose him in the future, there’s no harm in enjoying him now.

His arms wrap around you as you break down, his hand running upwards from your neck into your soft hair to rub at your scalp. “M’not going anywhere, married or not.”

~

With a heavy sigh Harry collapses into the armchair he always claims in his mum’s home. You’d cried for a little while, your tears collecting against the fabric of Harry’s t-shirt until they stained, and he’d coaxed you to lie down on his bed until you passed out sleeping.

No other words had been said between you since, just soft pecks to your face and hands every now and then as he held you. Even though you were crying, it was oddly relaxing.

“Is that what she really thinks of us?” Anne can’t help her question as she idly pets the cat in her lap.

“Hmm?” Harry frowns over at her.

Anne grimaces slightly, like she’s afraid to say the words out loud. “Does she really think we just want her married off to you?”

Harry shakes his head with a deeper frown. “No, I don’t think she meant it like that. I think she meant you’re obviously excited by the idea of us being married and she’s just intimidated by it a little. She worships our family, especially you.”

“I didn’t realise she felt that way about it, I’m a little surprised. Feel stupid for saying anything now.” Anne worries, hating the feeling that she might’ve upset you.

Harry sighs, rubbing his hand over his face. “Please don’t worry yourself over it, she just panicked. She might be a little sheepish in the morning but I know she still adores you the same way. She’s just terrified of disappointing everyone.”

“I don’t think I’ve ever felt disappointed by her.” Anne mutters.

“Me neither.”

~

You’re apprehensive to say the least. Anne probably hates you after your rude exit from dinner followed by a screaming match with Harry. And you wouldn’t blame her either, you kind of hate yourself anyway.

Harry has gone out for a run, which means it’s just you and Anne in the house. Yay.

You awkwardly shuffle into the kitchen where Anne is making breakfast, and you’re definitely surprised when she smiles at you. “Morning, love. Just boiled the kettle if you want a tea or coffee?”

“Thank you.” You mumble, making your way to where you know the mugs to be.

“About yesterday, love.” Anne begins, and your heart skitters with panic. “I’m sorry if I upset you, I didn’t realise you weren’t that comfortable with getting married.”

Great, I’ve made her feel bad. You turn to face her with a solemn expression. “No I overreacted. It’s perfectly normal for you to be excited about something like that but I just panicked.”

“Well, I don’t see you any differently. Whether you’re married to Harry or not you’re still a part of our family.”

Anne’s kind words have somehow lifted everything off your shoulders, and you feel lighter now than you have done for months. Maybe one day you will find the confidence to marry the man you love, but right now you’re happy to settle with the love of his family and his company.

~~~

Merci, loves 💕💕💕

With a heavy sigh Harry collapses into the armchair he always claims in his mum’s home. You’d cried for a little while, your tears collecting against the fabric of Harry’s t-shirt until they stained, and he’d coaxed you to lie down on his bed until you passed out sleeping.

No other words had been said between you since, just soft pecks to your face and hands every now and then as he held you. Even though you were crying, it was oddly relaxing.

“Is that what she really thinks of us?” Anne can’t help her question as she idly pets the cat in her lap.

“Hmm?” Harry frowns over at her.

Anne grimaces slightly, like she’s afraid to say the words out loud. “Does she really think we just want her married off to you?”

Harry shakes his head with a deeper frown. “No, I don’t think she meant it like that. I think she meant you’re obviously excited by the idea of us being married and she’s just intimidated by it a little. She worships our family, especially you.”

“I didn’t realise she felt that way about it, I’m a little surprised. Feel stupid for saying anything now.” Anne worries, hating the feeling that she might’ve upset you.

Harry sighs, rubbing his hand over his face. “Please don’t worry yourself over it, she just panicked. She might be a little sheepish in the morning but I know she still adores you the same way. She’s just terrified of disappointing everyone.”

“I don’t think I’ve ever felt disappointed by her.” Anne mutters.

“Me neither.”

~

You’re apprehensive to say the least. Anne probably hates you after your rude exit from dinner followed by a screaming match with Harry. And you wouldn’t blame her either, you kind of hate yourself anyway.

Harry has gone out for a run, which means it’s just you and Anne in the house. Yay.

You awkwardly shuffle into the kitchen where Anne is making breakfast, and you’re definitely surprised when she smiles at you. “Morning, love. Just boiled the kettle if you want a tea or coffee?”

“Thank you.” You mumble, making your way to where you know the mugs to be.

“About yesterday, love.” Anne begins, and your heart skitters with panic. “I’m sorry if I upset you, I didn’t realise you weren’t that comfortable with getting married.”

Great, I’ve made her feel bad. You turn to face her with a solemn expression. “No I overreacted. It’s perfectly normal for you to be excited about something like that but I just panicked.”

“Well, I don’t see you any differently. Whether you’re married to Harry or not you’re still a part of our family.”

Anne’s kind words have somehow lifted everything off your shoulders, and you feel lighter now than you have done for months. Maybe one day you will find the confidence to marry the man you love, but right now you’re happy to settle with the love of his family and his company.

~~~

Merci, loves 💕💕💕

This is a combo of all of the above requests, the last two of which I’m pretty sure are from @talesofstyles but I could be wrong… anyway, this is my last request of the weekend (yeet?) so later I’m going to write the next thing for A Series of Parental Events 😁 thoughts please! Kate xxx

A weekend away to Anne’s had seemed like the perfect idea when Harry had first suggested it. You both needed some time away, to relax and recover because you were both feeling a little overworked.

It’s been a hectic few months to say the least, with your own family seemingly trying to reek havoc in your life at every opportunity, you tend to lean into Harry’s family more because they’re more understanding. Your family don’t dislike Harry, no that’s not it. It’s more that they seem to think he’s a sort of toy, a shiny object to be shown off in front of other people. It’s more like a ‘look who our daughter managed to bag as her boyfriend’.

And you’d rather keep Harry away from that, because it’s the last thing he needs from anyone. He always says he doesn’t mind, but you mind. You love him, probably a bit too much, besotted being a more appropriate term. You love him with everything you have. Honestly, you’re surprised he’s not ran a hundred miles in the opposite direction. But he hadn’t.

“Oh I can’t wait to see you two get married one day.” Anne sighs contentedly after dinner, gazing across the table at you with a warmth you don’t think you’ve seen even from your own mother.

You evidently stiffen in your seat, Harry’s hand immediately clapping to your thigh as reassurance. You hate that you have to react this way, because as you’ve already mentioned you love the man with your whole ass fucking heart. But Anne doesn’t know if your insecurities to really commit. She doesn’t know that Harry’s already proposed once, with a ring and everything, and you said ‘no’. You said no because you’re terrified of failure. It’s not the marriage side of it, it’s the fact that in the future everything might not be so perfect, and you and Harry might just fall out of love with you and… divorce you. He maintains that he won’t regularly, but he can’t see into the future so how would he know?

Your entire life you’ve been surrounded by divorce, most people you know - their parents have divorced. You have friends who’ve already married and divorced, why would you be any different?

Harry tries to brush off the subject with an awkward laugh and a gentle squeeze to your thigh. “Steady on, Mum.”

“Well you’ve been together nearly four years!” Anne chuckles. “Poor girl probably thinks you don’t want to marry her!”

“He already asked.” You blurt, unable to look either of them in the eye all of a sudden. You’re hot with anxiety, you can already feel the panic starting to settle into the back of your neck. “He already asked and I said ‘no’.”

Anne confusedly blinks between the two of you, her brows slowly knitting together until they’re one. “You proposed, Harry?” She sounds hurt now, and that upsets you even more.

Harry swallows the lump in his throat. “I did, yeah. Few months back.” His voice is tight, ill with worry.

“Why didn’t you say anything?” Anne’s voice is soft, but still laced with a hurt that even you can’t ignore.

“Wanted it to be a surprise.” He shrugs, his tone verging on the point of sullen.

“It’s my fault, I’m the one that said ‘no’.” You stammer, wriggling in your seat as you continue to stare at the bend of the table.

“She’s not ready yet.” Harry surmises, slipping his hand from your thigh to lock his fingers with yours, like a show of solidarity that’s not really necessary. “And I’m okay with that.”

As much as you appreciate Harry’s understanding, the insinuation that you might be ready to marry in the future has your head spinning. Because what if you don’t ever find yourself ready? What if you never overcome that fear of failure? What if you really do end up losing him? Maybe it’d be safer to just end it..?

You quickly excuse yourself from the table before you break down in front of Harry and his mum, and flee to Harry’s bedroom to hide your looming panic attack in there. The comfort of Harry’s bedroom is simultaneously better and worse. Better because everything about him calms you, and the room is full of just him, even after years away from home his smell lingers on everything and it’s so completely intoxicating. But it’s worse because in your current frame of mind some of this may never be yours again, and that thought really has you sobbing.

“Hey,” Harry isn’t too far behind you, closing the door with a click and falling to his knees where you’re sat panting on the edge of the bed, “hey, I’m sorry. Maybe I should’ve told her, I didn’t know she’d react like that.”

You shake your head as you attempt to fight the tears that now threaten behind your eyes. “I don’t know if I can do this, Harry.”

Harry’s expression begins to mirror Anne’s from moments earlier, confusion washing over him. “What do you mean, love?”

“I mean I can’t give you what you want and it’s not fair.” You’re stressing over your words, your throat tight with every syllable you spit out.

“Angel, don’t do that.” Harry begs, taking both hands in his. “You don’t mean that.”

“Harry, your entire family are sitting on the edge of their seats waiting for me to say ‘yes’ so they can yomp me down the aisle! And I don’t know if I’ll ever be ready for that!” Your voice has raised in volume, like you’ve internally snapped and you’ve had enough.

“It doesn’t matter!”

“It does matter, Harry! It matters because regardless of the fact that we barely spoke about marriage before you proposed, it’s the only thing I’ve heard about since! And we’ve been together long enough that people are going to find it weird!”

Harry shakes his head, looking to the floor as he speaks. “Do you really think I care what other people want? I was done doing that a long time ago, I don’t intend to go back to it.”

“But you do want a wife and a family, and I don’t know if I’m the right person to give you that!”

Harry’s head snaps up, eyes brimming with wet tears. “Don’t do this, love. Please. If you’re worried about your family, you know I don’t mind them. If you never decide to marry me, I don’t care. I’d fucking love to have you as my wife, but I’d also happily have just you without the title. I just need you.”

“The thing is, Harry, I don’t know if just me is enough. You deserve more.”

“Stop it!” He scolds with a near scowl, standing quickly with your hands still in his. “You don’t get to just make this decision on your own! There’s two of us in this relationship, you can’t just throw away four years because you’re scared!”

“And you can’t force me to stay in it either!” You stand too, tearing your hands from his hold. “I don’t want to be the one your family hates because I won’t give you what you want!”

“Love, for the last time, I only want you!”

The last brick in your defensive wall is cracking, until it finally breaks and those tears you’ve been fighting win their way through. You feel defeated, deflated and a little defenceless. You’ve ran out of excuses to fight him with. You don’t want to leave him, not at all. You realise that throwing away your relationship with Harry would be throwing away the best thing you’ll ever have. And even if you do lose him in the future, there’s no harm in enjoying him now.

His arms wrap around you as you break down, his hand running upwards from your neck into your soft hair to rub at your scalp. “M’not going anywhere, married or not.”

~

With a heavy sigh Harry collapses into the armchair he always claims in his mum’s home. You’d cried for a little while, your tears collecting against the fabric of Harry’s t-shirt until they stained, and he’d coaxed you to lie down on his bed until you passed out sleeping.

No other words had been said between you since, just soft pecks to your face and hands every now and then as he held you. Even though you were crying, it was oddly relaxing.

“Hmm?” Harry frowns over at her.

Anne grimaces slightly, like she’s afraid to say the words out loud. “Does she really think we just want her married off to you?”

Harry shakes his head with a deeper frown. “No, I don’t think she meant it like that. I think she meant you’re obviously excited by the idea of us being married and she’s just intimidated by it a little. She worships our family, especially you.”

“I didn’t realise she felt that way about it, I’m a little surprised. Feel stupid for saying anything now.” Anne worries, hating the feeling that she might’ve upset you.

Harry sighs, rubbing his hand over his face. “Please don’t worry yourself over it, she just panicked. She might be a little sheepish in the morning but I know she still adores you the same way. She’s just terrified of disappointing everyone.”

“I don’t think I’ve ever felt disappointed by her.” Anne mutters.

“Me neither.”

~

Harry has gone out for a run, which means it’s just you and Anne in the house. Yay.

You awkwardly shuffle into the kitchen where Anne is making breakfast, and you’re definitely surprised when she smiles at you. “Morning, love. Just boiled the kettle if you want a tea or coffee?”

“Thank you.” You mumble, making your way to where you know the mugs to be.

“About yesterday, love.” Anne begins, and your heart skitters with panic. “I’m sorry if I upset you, I didn’t realise you weren’t that comfortable with getting married.”

“Well, I don’t see you any differently. Whether you’re married to Harry or not you’re still a part of our family.”

Anne’s kind words have somehow lifted everything off your shoulders, and you feel lighter now than you have done for months. Maybe one day you will find the confidence to marry the man you love, but right now you’re happy to settle with the love of his family and his company.

~~~
